summary:
Japan has the fourth-largest economy globally, known for its mix of traditional and modern industries. It's strong in manufacturing, especially cars, and is very innovative. Japan was one of the first Asian countries to become highly developed. It has a lot of international trade and a big consumer market. 

After World War II, Japan's economy grew quickly, becoming the second-largest in the world. However, it faced challenges in the 1990s, with a period of slow growth called the "Lost Decades." Recently, Japan has been dealing with an aging population and high public debt. Despite these issues, it remains a major economic power.
title: Economy of Japan
